avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last two days in high Alpine regions. Wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant.
Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes.
In particular low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and new snow above the tree line: Dry avalanches at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow as well as the sometimes large wind slabs formed during the snowfall must be evaluated with care and prudence.
Avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even large ones in isolated cases, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on steep sunny slopes.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The new snow of the last few days represents the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: 20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until midday. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The new snow and wind slabs can be released easily at intermediate and high altitudes.
Along the border with France a considerable avalanche danger will persist in some regions.
In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies in particular on very steep slopes.
Gradual increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind, wind slabs formed especially at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line.
